src

dXprint_X.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* The following is a set of functions intended primarily to facilitate 
00002 debugging.  But, they could easily be used for verbose data output within
00003 the program.  They all follow the same basic format:
00004 
00005 print_X(X x, int level)
00006 
00007 where   X = one of the structures defined above (e.g., molecule, residue, 
00008                 bondset, atom, bond, atype, plane, vectormag_3D, coord_3D).
00009         *x = pointer to your structure
00010         level = the depth to print.  This is only available on structures 
00011                 likely to contain arrays of other structures.  level=0 only
00012                 prints the top-level information.  level=1 prints one level 
00013                 down of other structures, lists, etc. level=2 prints two 
00014                 levels down, etc.   The value of level can be larger than 
00015                 the depth available -- the function will stop when it runs
00016                 out of structures to print.  
00017   Author: Lachele Foley
00018 */
00019 #include <mylib.h>
00020 #include <molecules.h>
00021 //#include "../inc/mylib.h"
00022 //#include "../inc/molecules.h"
00023 void dXprint_coord_3D(coord_3D *c){
00024         printf("coord i j k \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",c[0].i,c[0].j,c[0].k);
00025 return;
00026 }
00027 
00028 void dXprint_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D *v){
00029         printf("vectormag i j k d \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",v[0].i,v[0].j,v[0].k,v[0].d); 
00030 return;
00031 }
00032 
00033 void dXprint_plane(plane *p){
00034         printf("plane A B C D \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",p[0].A,p[0].B,p[0].C,p[0].D); 
00035 return;
00036 }
00037 
00038 void dXprint_atype(atype *t,int i){
00039         int pa=0;
00040         printf("atype \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; NT=>>%s<< ; m=%20.12f ; nb=%d\n",t[0].n,t[0].N,t[0].NT,t[0].m,t[0].nb);
00041         printf("\tdesc=>>%s<<\n",t[0].desc);
00042         if(i>0){ 
00043                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<t[0].nb));pa++){
00044                         printf("\t%20.12f",t[0].bo[pa]);
00045                         }
00046                 printf("\n");
00047                 }
00048 return;
00049 }
00050 
00051 void dXprint_bond(bond *b){
00052         printf("bond s t o \t%d \t%d \t%20.12f\n",b[0].s,b[0].t,b[0].o);
00053 return;
00054 }
00055 
00056 void dXprint_atom(atom *a,int i){
00057         int pa=0;
00058         printf("atom \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; t=%d ; nb=%d ; nalt=%d ; nvec=%d\n",a[0].n,a[0].N,\
00059                 a[0].t,a[0].nb,a[0].nalt,a[0].nvec);
00060         printf("\tcoords x y z \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",a[0].x.i,a[0].x.j,a[0].x.k); 
00061         if(i>0){
00062                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nb));pa++){
00063                         printf("\tbond set %d:  ",pa);
00064                         dXprint_bond(&(a[0].b[pa])); 
00065                         }
00066                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nalt));pa++){
00067                         printf("\talt coord set %d:  ",pa);
00068                         dXprint_coord_3D(&(a[0].xa[pa])); 
00069                         }
00070                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nvec));pa++){
00071                         printf("\tset %d:  ",pa);
00072                         dXprint_vectormag_3D(&(a[0].v[pa])); 
00073                         }
00074                 } 
00075 return;
00076 }
00077 
00078 void dXprint_bondset(bondset *bs,int i){
00079         int pa=0;
00080         printf("bondset contains n=%d bonds\n",bs[0].n);
00081         if(i>0){
00082                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<bs[0].n));pa++){
00083                         printf("\tconsec bonds set %d : \t",pa);
00084                         dXprint_bond(&(bs[0].b[pa]));
00085                         }
00086                 }
00087 return;
00088 }
00089 
00090 void dXprint_residue(residue *r,int i){
00091         int pa=0;
00092         printf("residue \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; na=%d ; nbs=%d ; nr=%d \n",r[0].n,r[0].N,\
00093                 r[0].na,r[0].nbs,r[0].nr); 
00094         if(i>0){
00095                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].na));pa++){
00096                         printf("\tatom set %d\n",pa);
00097                         dXprint_atom(&(r[0].a[pa]),i); 
00098                         }
00099                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nbs));pa++){
00100                         printf("\tconsec. lin, bondset set %d\n",pa);
00101                         dXprint_bondset(&(r[0].bs[pa]),i); 
00102                         }
00103                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrbs));pa++){
00104                         printf("\tconsec. ring bondset set %d\n",pa);
00105                         dXprint_bondset(&(r[0].rbs[pa]),i); 
00106                         }
00107                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrc));pa++){
00108                         printf("\tconsec ring coords set %d:  ",pa);
00109                         dXprint_coord_3D(&(r[0].rc[pa])); 
00110                         }
00111                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrp));pa++){
00112                         printf("\tring plane set %d:  ",pa);
00113                         dXprint_plane(&(r[0].rp[pa])); 
00114                         }
00115                 } 
00116 return;
00117 }
00118 
00119 void dXprint_molecule(molecule *m,int i){
00120         int pa=0;
00121         printf("molecule \ti=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; nr=%d \n",m[0].i,m[0].N,m[0].nr); 
00122         if(i>0){
00123                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<m[0].nr));pa++){
00124                         printf("\t\tset %d\n",pa);
00125                         dXprint_residue(&(m[0].r[pa]),i); 
00126                         }
00127                 }
00128 return;
00129 }
